DOC.brief_summary: The objective study test efficacy low-dose aspirin ( 160 mg/day ) , give bedtime start early pregnancy ( ≤ 15 +6 week gestation ) nulliparous pregnant woman select `` high-risk '' presence bilateral uterine artery notch and/or bilateral uterine artery PI ≥ 1.7 first trimester ultrasound scan ( 11-13+6 week ) , prevent occurrence pre-eclampsia small gestational age birth .
DOC.brief_title: Prevention Pre-eclampsia SGA Low-Dose Aspirin Nulliparous Women With Abnormal First-trimester Uterine Artery Dopplers
DOC.criteria: Age ≥ 18 year Nulliparous ( previous pregnancy ≥ 22 SA ) Singleton pregnancy Gestational age ≤ 15 +6 week Bilateral uterine artery notch ( grade ≥ 2 ) and/or bilateral uterine artery PI ≥ 1.7 first trimester ultrasound ( CRL 45 84 mm ) Maternal informed consent obtain Affiliated social security system Women consider voluntary pregnancy termination ( ≤ 14 week ) Preexisting ( maternal ) indication premature delivery 37 week Fetal condition detect first trimester scan ( fetal malformation nuchal translucency ≥ 95th percentile ) Women anticoagulation Allergy hypersensitivity Kardegic® one constituent Secondary hemostasis disorder responsible bleeding risk bleed Peptic ulcer evolution Lupus antiphospholipid syndrome
